intro: Tenicroa flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzag or flexible tenicroa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and often have a zigzag or wavy margin, which gives it its common name. The flowers are small and white or greenish, arranged in clusters that attract various pollinators.
